title: Seizure Medicines
author: Authored By
description: Medicine is the most common way of treating epilepsy and is almost always the first treatment tried.
cleaned_text: Seizure Medicines Medicine Is The Most Common Way Of Treating Epilepsy And Is Almost Always The First Treatment Tried There are many different medicines that can prevent or stop seizures. These are called anti-seizure medications (ASMs). They will successfully control seizures for about 7 out of 10 people with epilepsy. Some medicines tend to work better for certain kinds of seizures than for others. If one medicine fails, another may work better. A combination of medications may be tried too. The medications don't fix the problem that causes seizures. Instead, they work to stop seizures from occurring. This section provides in-depth information on anti-seizure medications and how to use them. It's important to talk with your doctor about the pros and cons of the different seizure medicines available to treat your kind of epilepsy. Important Information [Taking your medication regularly is essential to controlling your seizures.](/learn/treating-seizures-and-epilepsy/seizure-and-epilepsy-medicines/importance-taking-medication) - Never [stop](/learn/treating-seizures-and-epilepsy/seizure-and-epilepsy-medicines/stopping-medication)or change your medication without talking to your doctor, as this could cause a severe seizure. When To Seek Specialty Care If your seizures are difficult to control, meaning you continue to have seizures after one year or after two anti-seizure medications have been tried, we recommend seeking more [specialized care](/connect/find-epilepsy-specialist). [Epilepsy centers](/connect/find-epilepsy-specialist/find-epilepsy-center) provide a [team approach](/learn/managing-your-epilepsy/managing-my-seizures-101/my-health-care-team) to caring for people with seizures and epilepsy. [Testing](/learn/diagnosing-epilepsy) is available to diagnose whether a person has [seizures](/learn/types-seizures) and the [type of epilepsy](/learn/types-epilepsy-syndromes) they may have. Epilepsy experts can help explore all treatment options, including [new or add-on to get the best seizure control possible."
